newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -T-bonds to plod between 106-24 and 107-24.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -T-bonds to plod between 106-24 and 107-24.

text.p: LONDON, April 29 - June T-bond futures will trade within a one-point range on Tuesday, as technical factors take a back seat to this week's stream of U.S. economic data, technical analysts said.
"The market is not ready to make a directional statement until it sees the data this week," said Tom Hobson, director of technical research at Merrill Lynch International in London.
The contract will be confined by 107-24 on the upside, the April 18 low and just above Thursday's close, and 106-24 on the downside, close to the April 4 low, analysts said.
T-bonds were at 107-09 in automated trade at 1004 GMT.
The market was trading 4/32 below Monday's Chicago close.
The data flow begins with the release of the first quarter employment cost index and March durable goods at 1230 GMT on Tuesday, and April consumer confidence at 1400 GMT.
Mike Macdonald, technical analyst at 4CAST in London, said T-bonds had been trending down since February and there was still some minor downside potential.
"We could possibly have a re-test of yesterday's low at 106-30 and then a break towards 106-12/17, the mid-April lows," he said adding that a base was developing above 106-12.
That level was the low on April 11.
"It won't go beneath there yet, momentum is in a bull channel so there is still some upside bias to the contract," said Macdonald.
"Last week the market could not take out resistance, which left it with a negative bias, and yesterday the bears tried to push it through support," said Hobson.
Bigger picture resistance for the contract was at 108-15, Hobson said, while key support lay at 106-00.
Macdonald said first resistance was at 107-27, the April 24 high, and above there at recent highs from 108-05 to 108-11.
"It should find some pressure around there as downside was strong last week. But anything above 108-11 takes us up to 108-23," he said.
Before 108-23, Macdonald said there was also resistance at 108-16. That level is a 61.8 percent Fibonacci retracement of the fall from 109-25 on March 25 to 106-12.
"There will probably be some reactions there," he said.
September Eurodollar futures were quoted at 93.680 in automated trade at 1015 GMT, against a Chicago close of 93.695.
